messages.title: 5 MORE YEARS OF LABOUR OR CHANGE WITH THE CONSERVATIVES
messages.content: In just a few weeks we will have the most important election for a generation. Our economy is burdened by huge debts and our political work. Our Society is broken by crime and irresponsibility.

messages.title: 3 POSITIVE REASONS TO VOTE FOR PETER DUNCAN
messages.content: Get Dumfries and Galloway working again. Strengthen schools, hospitals and police stations. Fighting for pensioners.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: The Conservatives will halt Labour's cuts of post offices across the country, viewing the closures as losing vital services in towns and rural parts of Dumfries and Galloway.
Peter Duncan has backed road schemes for improvements, including the A75 and A77 upgrades.

Lack of affordable housing is a real problem for local residents. Conservatives will take action to help local people in putting plans in place to ensure affordable housing exists for those looking to buy or rent new homes.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: LOCAL BUSINESSES: USE THEM OR LOSE THEM
keyPolicies.policyDescription: The candidate speaks about avoiding the threats to local stores, stating that the Conservatives are assisting local business and that voters are starting to back our local economy.

issues.economy: Getting the local economy back on its feet after the recession.
issues.governance: Our Society is broken by crime and irresponsibility.
issues.socialWelfare: Fighting for pensioners to protect the Disability Living Allowance and Attendance Allowance for over 65's.

housing.content: Lack of affordable housing is a real problem for local residents. Plans to ensure affordable housing exists for those looking to buy or rent new homes.

leaflet.personalStatement: Peter is an experienced local campaigner and former small businessman who has always put Dumfries and Galloway first.

politicalExperience.role: local campaigner and former small businessman
politicalExperience.achievements: Invested in town centres and fought for post offices. Worked with councilors, MPs, and local campaigners to ensure they must heed warnings we came to our region.
